Class FastaSequences

  • java.lang.Object
    • sequences.FastaSequences
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequence

    public class FastaSequences
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sequence

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastaSequences

        public FastaSequences(java.lang.String directory,
              boolean randomAccess)
        Constructor create an object using the standard 20 amino acids (18 unique masses)
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory where the fasta files are located
        randomAccess - flag to indicate loading of all sequences into memory

      • FastaSequences

        public FastaSequences(java.lang.String directory,
              java.lang.String aaSpec,
              boolean randomAccess)
        Constructor using an specific amino acid alphabet specification
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory of the fasta files
        aaSpec - the amino acid alphabet specification
        randomAccess - flag to indicate loading of all sequences into memory

        public int getAlphabetSize()
        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Returns the number of letters in the alphabet of this database.
        Specified by:

      • getAnnotation

        public java.lang.String getAnnotation(long position)
        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Get the annotation corresponds to the given position. Annotation can be any string. For example, if the object represented is a fasta file, annotation will be the lines start with ">".
        Specified by:
        getAnnotation in interface Sequence
        Parameters:
        position - the position to query. Annotations are mapped to certain ranges of the sequence indices, so this function will return the annotation for the subsequence that falls within this range
        Returns:
        the annotation string corresponds to the given position.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Get the unique identified for this sequence.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface Sequence
        Returns:

      • getMatchingEntry

        public java.lang.String getMatchingEntry(long position)
        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Get the complete entry that corresponds to the given position. A chunk is a contiguous sequence that shares an annotation (e.g. Protein).
        Specified by:
        getMatchingEntry in interface Sequence
        Parameters:
        position - the position to query.
        Returns:
        the entry as a string corresponds to the given position.

        Specified by:
        getMatchingEntry in interface Sequence
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the entry as a string.

      • toChar

        public char toChar(byte b)
        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Take a byte and reverse translate it to the original string representation. Note that some bytes might represent more than one character. An arbitrary character is returned. To find out what the original char was, the getCharAt method should be called instead
        Specified by:
        toChar in interface Sequence
        Parameters:
        b - the byte.
        Returns:
        the String representation of the given byte.

      • getAlphabetAsBytes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Byte> getAlphabetAsBytes()
        Description copied from interface: Sequence
        Return the set of bytes that are valid for sequence. This is the alphabet set in the form of bytes (including the terminator character, but excluding un-encodable characters).
        Specified by:
        getAlphabetAsBytes in interface Sequence
        Returns:
        the byte alphabet set
